item.title: Taylor Swift sings about 'eldest daughter syndrome', but is it real?
item.description: Jess King says being the firstborn child in her family brought a weight of responsibility and she still struggles with feelings that she's "not doing enough".

item.title: Tasmanian budget 2025 shows lower forecast state debt, few new savings measures
item.description: Tasmanian Treasurer Eric Abetz has vowed to take "decisive action" to rein in the ballooning debt, but the "interim" state budget contains few major initiatives.

item.title: Cassowary wandering 150km from home in Queensland's Gulf Savannah baffles residents
item.description: Queensland's department of environment says it has no plans to relocate a cassowary spotted roaming the dry Gulf Savannah.

item.title: Hail and heavy rain batter West Australia's Great Southern and Wheatbelt region
item.description: Severe weather has swept through large parts of the Great Southern and Wheatbelt, causing significant damage to crops during the critical harvest period.

item.title: Port Adelaide coach Josh Carr denies Warren Tredrea has been kicked out of club
item.description: Warren Tredrea's premiership teammate Josh Carr says he will always remain a Port Adelaide legend despite being sacked from the club's board last week.

item.title: Adelaide artist Peter 'Jungle' Phillips dies aged 69 in his gallery home
item.description: Known for his generosity and a spectacular art gallery home filled with colourful works, Peter "Jungle" Phillips is remembered by those who loved him dearly.

item.title: Katter's present comes early, Coalition stalls on net zero New Year's resolution
item.description: "There will be a corner of this Parliament House that is forever Bob Katter," the prime minister said this week.

item.title: The art of price baiting — how real estate agents lure buyers to auction
item.description: To advertise a property for $1 million, knowing it must sell above $1.3 million, is illegal. It is called underquoting, and in NSW it is rife, according to data analysis.

item.title: Federal government approves expansion of Victoria's largest gold mine near Bendigo
item.description: Fosterville Gold Mine in central Victoria is approved to continue running until 2045 despite concerns from neighbours and environmental advocates.

item.title: Liberals recalled to parliament to thrash out net zero problem
item.description: Liberal MPs will return to parliament on Wednesday to thrash out a position on the party's net zero commitment ahead of a joint party room meeting with the Nationals next Sunday.

item.title: Anti-corruption commission watchdog inquiring into NACC chief Paul Brereton
item.description: The inspector of the National Anti-Corruption Commission is inquiring into the agency's head, Paul Brereton, in relation to several complaints including from a former employee.

item.title: How Zohran Mamdani's triumph in New York is making waves around the world
item.description: The blistering rise of New York City's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, has captured global attention. So what's going on and what does his win say about the American political climate?

item.title: Kangaroos not offended Hawthorn players missed Jasmine Garner's guard of honour after 100th AFLW game
item.description: Hawthorn players were noticeably absent from the guard of honour for North star Jasmine Garner after her 100th AFLW game, but the reigning champs are not too fussed about it.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: India beat Australia in fourth T20I by 48 runs on Gold Coast, lead series 2-1
item.description: Australia lost 9-52 as India's spinners took control in a 48-run win in the fourth T20 international on the Gold Coast.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: William Dalrymple on the surprising history of India
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Australia's $4 billion illicit tobacco trade has become one of the nation's most violent criminal markets
item.description: Authorities stress the $4 billion figure is conservative, as it does not include illegal vapes and e-cigarettes.

item.title: German police investigate swastikas drawn in human blood
item.description: The Nazi symbol was smeared dozens of times on cars, letter boxes and building facades, with tests confirming they were daubed in human blood.

item.title: Louvre managers prioritised art over upgrading security in years before heist, report says
item.description: France's highest auditor says the theft of $157 million worth of jewels was a "deafening alarm bell" for the world-renowned Parisian museum.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi will not contest next US midterm elections, ending storied career
item.description: Ms Pelosi was the first woman to serve as US speaker of the House of Representatives, and her decision will bring to an end a political career spanning four decades.

item.title: Inaction on 1.5C climate change target a 'moral failure', says UN secretary-general at COP30
item.description: Missing from the line-up at the key summit in Brazil are the leaders of four of the world's five most-polluting economies — China, the United States, India and Russia.

item.title: 2025 among three warmest years on record, according to World Meteorological Organization
item.description: According to the global meteorological organisation, each of the past 11 years has been the warmest in 176 years of observations.

item.title: Fashion boss Shmuel Tal to face trial over alleged violent sexual offences in Byron Bay
item.description: A millionaire fashion boss is banned from entering Byron Bay's party precinct as he awaits trial over violent sexual offences.

item.title: Carter Gordon named at flyhalf for Wallabies look to avenge Italy defeat
item.description: The code-hopping Carter Gordon will be back in the starting No.10 shirt for the Wallabies against Italy in Udine as Tane Edmed reverts to the bench.

item.title: Former RAH electrician to receive $2.26 million asbestos cancer damages claim
item.description: An electrician diagnosed with a rare asbestos-related cancer has been awarded a $2.26 million payout for exposure to toxic dust and fibres while working for various employers, including at the old Royal Adelaide Hospital.

item.title: Hundreds of Queensland babies may have missed vital newborn blood screening tests
item.description: The ABC can reveal that in July last year, Queensland Health department became aware of "inconsistencies" in records of the newborn blood spot screening program.

item.title: Muswellbrook bans dongas at renewable energy and construction project sites
item.description: An Upper Hunter council is banning donga-style temporary work camps and demanding that developers build permanent, reusable housing.

item.title: Queenslanders warned about 'disaster chasers' targeting storm-hit homeowners
item.description: When three men turned up on Geoff Wilson's doorstep offering to check his roof for damage he took them up on it. But a requirement that the repairs must be done by a builder of their choice put him on alert.

item.title: Alex de Minaur learns ATP Finals fate as Carlos Alcaraz, Novak Djokovic await
item.description: Australian hope Alex de Minaur must get past world No.2 Carlos Alcaraz and 24-time grand slam winner Novak Djokovic to progress at the ATP Finals in Turin.

item.title: AI therapists don't judge, sleep or need an appointment — but experts urge it be used with caution
item.description: Artificial intelligence chatbots like ChatGPT are embedded in modern life, with some Australians using them to help work through PTSD and toxic work environments.

item.title: These charts show the effect of migration on Australia's housing story
item.description: The role of migration is one of the most contentious elements to the housing debate. So what does the evidence show?

item.title: Federal politics: Sussan Ley won't remark on 'good senator' Henderson's jab — as it happened
item.description: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley would not be drawn on comments from Liberal senator Sarah Henderson who openly declared the Liberal leader was losing support in the party room.

item.title: ASX closes lower as Macquarie shares tumble, Tesla shareholders approve Elon Musk's trillion-dollar pay deal — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market finished lower on Friday — its second consecutive weekly drop, with Macquarie shares tumbling on a disappointing earnings update.

item.title: Safety issues delay the reopening of six regional South Australian hospital helipads
item.description: Paul Logos may never know for sure if his wife's recent death could have been preventable by helipad access. Six helipads throughout regional South Australia remain closed due to issues in certifying their safety.

item.title: Builders hopeful a wind down of Melbourne's Big Build will bring tradies back
item.description: Hundreds of regional tradies were lured to the city by higher government wages to work on the West Gate and Metro Tunnel projects, but now those Victorian government projects are nearing completion.

item.description: What flies like a helicopter and devours mosquitoes? Meet the 2025 ABC Australian Insect of the Year.

item.description: The Queensland Country Women's Association pushes for Coolangatta's hall to be listed on the local heritage register in the hope it will deter pushy developers from snapping up the property.

item.description: With her West Coast AFLW side on the cusp of its first finals appearance, coach Daisy Pearce reflects on the huge strides the women's game has made since her own playing days.

item.title: SunCable looks to Muckaty Station for solar project's proposed expansion
item.description: An ambitious outback solar project backed by billionaire Mike Cannon-Brookes could soon grow even bigger.

item.title: China agrees to import 65,000 tonnes of Australian canola after five-year lockout
item.description: China is accepting the first bulk shipment of Australian canola in five years and farmers are hoping the trial leads to a formal resumption of the trade.

item.title: Actress Pauline Collins of Shirley Valentine fame dies aged 85
item.description: Pauline Collins was adept at playing an array of roles, all of which she infused with her trademark authenticity that earned her the status of a "national sweetheart" in the UK.

item.description: The main characters are dead. Some of those still around from the time maintain their rage, which has lasted through the decades, long after that election campaign.

item.description: People could be allowed to keep dingoes as pets in Queensland under proposed changes to biosecurity regulations, but experts say the native animal is fundamentally different to domestic dogs.

item.description: Jake Weatherald feared playing for Australia was out of reach when dropped by South Australia, but a move to Tasmania has him on the verge of a Test debut.

item.title: Architect of NT police anti-racism strategy describes 'hardest job' of her life
item.description: Leanne Liddle knows what it takes to cut it as a police officer, but says tackling racism within the ranks has been her toughest assignment yet.

item.description: Conservation groups warn that proposed job cuts to the NSW Environment Protection Authority will leave the state vulnerable to waste dumping and illegal logging.

item.description: Sussan Ley has refused to bite on speculation about her leadership, after a Liberal colleague suggested she was losing the support of her party.

item.description: A 30-year-old woman and a 10-year-old girl are dead and another passenger remains in intensive care in the remote Aboriginal community of Doomadgee after a serious traffic crash.

item.title: India's World Cup victory will be remembered as a historic turning point for women's cricket
item.description: In a short period of time, women's cricket in India has travelled from uneven, dusty grounds to floodlit stadiums packed with roaring fans. The team's upset victory promises yet more investment in the women's game from the world's most fanatical cricketing nation.

item.description: Antoine Fuqua's movie was meant to be released months ago, but was delayed twice because of reshoots and eventually pushed back to April 2026 — a whole year behind schedule.

item.title: Tasmanian farmed salmon industry granted emergency federal approval to use florfenicol antibiotic
item.description: The industry's use of the drug is in response to an "endemic" bacterial disease that caused the deaths of up to 15,000 tonnes of salmon from January to April, resulting in dead fish material washing up on multiple beaches.

item.description: A Russian drone slams into an apartment building in eastern Ukraine, killing three people, while another is killed at an energy site, Ukrainian authorities report.

item.title: New food safety rules for produce in Tasmania have smaller growers worried
item.description: The new regulations would bring Tasmania into line with national standards, but smaller growers are worried they will have to pay the same fees and meet the same auditing requirements as large-scale growers.

item.title: Women's pain inquiry finds Victorians' suffering worsened by male-centred healthcare system
item.description: A Victorian inquiry has found a dismissive and disrespectful healthcare system centred around men is contributing to poorer outcomes for women and girls.

item.title: Princess Anne attends service at Hall of Remembrance in Sydney
item.description: Royal loyalists celebrate the Princess Royal's visit to Australia amid the scandal engulfing her brother, Andrew Mountbatten Windsor.

item.title: Spearmint milk and Hawaiian packs included in celebration of WA's food history
item.description: An exhibition exploring Western Australia's food history in all its guises, including its fast-food pioneers, is on show at the State Library.

item.title: Wallabies lament poor performance in 26-19 Test rugby loss to Italy
item.description: Wallabies captain Harry Wilson says he is "hurting" after Australia's 26-19 loss to Italy, while coach Joe Schmidt is lamenting his side's "flat performance".

item.title: Bragg pledges to do ‘right thing’ if Liberal party scraps net zero commitment
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Oasis leaves Australia after triumphant sold-out tour, with no signs of brotherly discord
item.description: Playing to a combined audience of about 320,000 people, Liam and Noel Gallagher's return to Australia for this much-hyped tour has been nothing short of a triumph.

item.title: The J Awards has been loud and proud about Australian music for 20 years
item.description: The centrepiece of triple j's Ausmusic Month celebrations, the J Awards is celebrating its 20th anniversary in 2025. Here's how it all began.

item.title: International students are struggling with Australia's cost of living — and experts say there is no quick fix
item.description: International students are grappling with Australia's high cost of living, and experts warn there are no quick fixes to their financial stress.

item.title: Kangaroo activity increasing on South Australian regional roads, with collisions up by about 40 per cent
item.description: Drivers on regional roads are being warned of an increase in kangaroo activity on South Australian roads, with large mobs of roos seen lining roads at dawn and dusk, creating growing safety concerns for road users.

item.title: Annemarie Manders reflects on 35 years as a lavender farmer in the Yarra Valley
item.description: Annemarie Manders reflects on how she became a lavender farmer in the Yarra Valley.

item.title: Grampians hosts Oceania's only World Trail Majors race as ultra-runners ascend Gariwerd
item.description: Nepali runner Sangé Sherpa returns to the Grampians with an unconventional race tactic and a global field of competitors chasing him.

item.title: Labor Party members vote for fracking ban to be extended across all parts of WA
item.description: Labor party members call for hydraulic fracturing, or fracking, to be banned across the whole of WA.

item.title: Firefighters battle out-of-control blaze in New Zealand national park
item.description: Fire and Emergency New Zealand says an out-of-control wildfire in Tongariro National Park has swelled in size to about 1,000 hectares, leading to the evacuation of dozens of hikers.

item.title: At least two dead as Super Typhoon Fung-wong nears landfall in the Philippines
item.description: The Philippines has evacuated more than a million people ahead of Super Typhoon Fung-wong making landfall.

item.title: The telltale signs the Louvre heist was not a 'professional' job
item.description: A series of missteps shows the theft in the Louvre was far from a sleek operation. Instead, French authorities believe petty criminals executed it.

item.title: Thinking 'outside the box' to bolster WA's housing supply
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Feelings of failure and being unseen. What it's like to be a stepmum
item.description: There is no road map for step-parenting, and experts say a common mistake is assuming it will be easy.

item.title: AFLW finals: Brisbane Lions beat Melbourne by 13 points to reach prelim final, Adelaide beats St Kilda
item.description: Brisbane defeats Melbourne for the first time in AFLW finals, as the Lions win on the road to clinch a preliminary final spot, and Adelaide ends St Kilda's season.

item.title: Australia beats New Zealand 40-8 to defend Women's Pacific Cup crown
item.description: Julia Robinson scores twice as Australia defeats New Zealand 40-8 to claim a second consecutive Pacific Cup in emphatic fashion.

item.title: Cook Islands qualify for Rugby League World Cup, beating South Africa 58-6 in Sydney
item.description: Cook Islands book their spot in a fourth Rugby League World Cup, turning it on to beat South Africa 58-6 in Sydney.

item.title: Police should have broken up neo-Nazi stunt, NSW opposition says
item.description: NSW Police should have gone to court to stop a neo-Nazi stunt outside Parliament House, Opposition Leader Mark Speakman says.

item.title: Coverage of embattled Perth builder, WA's 'most vulnerable child', among award-winning journalism
item.description: Coverage of the collapse of Perth builder Nicheliving, WA's 'most vulnerable child' and the state's guardianship system is among the award-winning journalism at the state's media awards.

item.title: Majority of Australia's first Ashes Test squad to feature in Sheffield Shield round four
item.description: Fourteen members of Australia's 15-man squad for the first Ashes Test will take part in this week's Sheffield Shield fixtures, while England will play an intra-squad game in Perth.

item.title: Spooked investors worry the AI bubble could pop
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Salt-N-Pepa, White Stripes inducted into Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
item.description: A star-studded line-up including Elton John, Chappell Roan, Stevie Wonder and Cyndi Lauper performs at LA's Peacock Theatre for a ceremony to induct Salt-N-Pepa, Warren Zevon, Sound Garden, Outkast, Bad Company and the White Stripes into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame.

item.title: New Zealand defeats Samoa 36-14 to claim Pacific Cup and farewell Kieran Foran in style
item.description: New Zealand overturns an eight-point half-time deficit to defeat Samoa 36-14 and claim its second Pacific Cup.

item.title: Why the Pacific Championship final should be a look into rugby league's future
item.description: New Zealand stopped Samoa from making history in the Pacific Championship final but the match was a tantalising reminder of what's possible for rugby league in the days to come.

item.title: Veteran radio broadcaster John Laws dies aged 90
item.description: Known as the "Golden Tonsils", Laws was one of Australia's most recognisable voices in talkback radio.

item.title: From jackaroo to 'Golden Tonsils' radio titan: the life and career of John Laws
item.description: John Laws, also known as "Golden Tonsils", spent a mammoth 71 years on air at stations such as Sydney's 2UE and 2SM, before retiring in November 2024.

item.title: Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin's remains return to Israel
item.description: Hamas hands over Hadar Goldin's remains as part of its ceasefire agreement with Israel.

item.title: Super Typhoon Fung-wong makes landfall in the Philippines
item.description: The massive storm has already left at least two people dead and forced more than a million people to evacuate from flood and landslide-prone areas.

item.title: F1 Brazil results: Oscar Piastri fifth after São Paulo Grand Prix penalty as Lando Norris increases lead in standings
item.description: Oscar Piastri's Formula 1 title challenge has taken another blow, with a controversial penalty costing the Australian in Brazil.

item.title: Alex de Minaur defeated in ATP Finals by Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(5), 6-2
item.description: Top seed Carlos Alcaraz began his bid for a first ATP Finals trophy with a 7-6(5), 6-2 win over Australian Alex de Minaur in their round-robin clash at the season-ending championships in Turin on Sunday.

item.title: Americans face food cuts and flight delays in record US government shutdown
item.description: Unpaid federal workers are turning to food banks and draining their savings as the longest US government shutdown in history drags on.

item.title: Tassal suffers fish kill at barramundi farm in WA's Cone Bay amid expansion plans
item.description: Foreign-owned aquaculture company Tassal suffers a fish kill at its barramundi farm in WA's Cone Bay, where the company has plans to expand.

item.title: Victoria's Wurundjeri people file native title claim for Melbourne
item.description: The Wurundjeri Woi-wurrung people in Victoria have filed a native title claim with the Federal Court, seeking recognition over country that spans much of Melbourne.

item.title: Crime rise at Melbourne shopping centres sparks calls for action
item.description: Crime has increased at several major Melbourne shopping centres with concerned communities calling for more action.

item.title: Poatina community agrees on new by-laws, unwinding Christian charity Fusion Australia's 30-year ownership
item.description: Fusion Australia has owned and run the former Hydro Tasmania town in Tasmania's Northern Midlands for 30 years, but is now divesting its assets there, clearing the way for a new generation of residents.

item.title: Renewable energy 'spilled' as generation outgrows demand
item.description: Mountains of clean power are regularly "wasted" as Australia's energy system evolves. But a large amount of battery storage is waiting in the wings, ready to soak it up.

item.title: Liberal decision on net zero unlikely to resolve bitter internal divide
item.description: As Liberals descend on Canberra to settle a climate policy, conservatives and moderates remain opposed on the question of net zero, threatening a deeper rupture.

item.title: Replacing Sussan Ley as Liberal leader isn't an easy fix to the party's problems
item.description: As the federal Liberal Party embarks on more self-harm over climate change policy this week, the idea seems to have set in among some that tearing down its first ever female leader could be a low-consequence affair.

item.title: Are Australia and its rare earths part of the solution to 'magnet shock'?
item.description: Anyone who controls the supply of magnets controls the future, and China has been quietly working on this under America's nose for decades. Can Australia muscle in?

item.title: Time running out for Australia to win the rights to host COP31 in Adelaide
item.description: It is almost crunch time for Australia to secure hosting rights for the next COP meeting, so it is timely to examine why the government's bid is languishing and how it can resolve a long-running stand-off with Türkiye.

item.title: Australians outside major cities are losing confidence in democracy, report finds
item.description: Experts warn Australia's democratic institutions need more protection as confidence falls.

item.title: City of Melbourne rejects Mildura's attempt to return 'Yellow Peril' home
item.description: City of Melbourne rejects Mildura's attempt to take the city's controversial "Yellow Peril" sculpture.

item.title: Top BBC bosses resign over edit of Donald Trump documentary
item.description: Britain's public broadcaster has been criticised for editing a speech Mr Trump delivered on January 6, 2021, before protesters attacked the US Capitol in Washington.

item.title: Beyond the Box showcases Australian artists using cardboard to create art
item.description: Artists have been using cardboard for at least a century to create works. These Australians showcase how the humble medium can be transformed into striking sculptures and collage.

item.title: This week in history quiz: Step back in time with a space selfie, a bonus public holiday and cricket royalty
item.description: A life-changing postal vote in Australia, Michelle Obama's book and the first selfie in space — how well do you know your history?

item.title: Dozens missing in Malaysia after boat carrying migrants sinks
item.description: The boat was carrying about 100 migrants, including Rohingya Muslims fleeing conflict, hunger and ethnic violence in Myanmar.

item.title: Ashleigh Gardner stars for Sydney Sixes with 5-15 in big WBBL win over Perth Scorchers
item.description: Melbourne Renegades repeat last season's WBBL final win over Brisbane Heat while the Sixers crush Perth by 10 wickets at the WACA.

item.title: Adelaide waits for COP31 decision as security preparations ramp up
item.description: As the UN's annual climate change conference kicks off in Brazil, authorities in Adelaide are still in the dark about whether Australia's fifth-biggest city will be hosting next year's event.

item.title: Split Enz announce reunion with details for 2026 tour
item.description: It's been 50 years since Split Enz's debut album. Now they're getting the band back together for a string of arena dates in next year.

item.title: New report calls on Queensland government to convert Brisbane 2032 athletes' village into social housing
item.description: Homelessness advocates fear housing affordability and availability will fall short of the finish line come the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games.

item.title: AFL gives teams finishing 10th chance to win premiership through wildcard round in finals
item.description: AFL teams ranked ninth and 10th will be in contention to win the premiership from next season, with the league introducing a wildcard round.

item.title: Markets live updates: ANZ profit falls, Wall Street edges higher after volatile session but tech stocks slide again, ASX set to rise
item.description: ANZ has posted a 10 per cent slide in net profit to $5.9 billion ahead of a day where the ASX is expected to rise. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Federal politics live: Barnaby Joyce labels renewable energy a 'total swindle'
item.description: Nationals MP Barnaby Joyce has labelled renewable energy a "total swindle" and has refused to say whether he would support an extension of energy rebates. Follow live.

item.title: Some apartment buildings in Darwin have serious structural problems
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Respected engineer sounds alarm on extent of defective Darwin apartment buildings
item.description: A respected consulting engineer says about 80 per cent of apartment buildings he has inspected in Darwin have serious structural issues.

item.title: Wallabies 'not looking for excuses' after defeat to Italy
item.description: Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt says his weary charges must toughen up rather than seek excuses after falling to Italy in Udine, ahead of two more severe tests to come.

item.title: John Laws always knew how to hold an audience in his hand
item.description: On 7.30 in 2012, John Laws held forth with his customary flair and confidence and then as I wrapped up, he delivered probably the most memorable and amusing ending to any interview I've done.

item.title: John Laws speaks to Leigh Sales about Alan Jones
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Mildura Base Public Hospital caught duplicating feedback figures in annual reports
item.description: A Victorian hospital has been caught copying and pasting its compliments and concerns data, after failing to update figures across multiple years of its annual reports.

item.title: Cable car on Kunanyi/Mount Wellington included in draft recommendations, Right to Information documents show
item.description: The Tasmanian government has made a draft recommendation for a cable car on Hobart's Kunanyi/Mount Wellington, documents released under Right to Information laws show.
